title: Graph Theory-Based Content Sequencing for Language Learning Course Design

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of core concepts and intermediate-level application skills
context.additional_context: Learners aim to improve job-linked language proficiency, with collaborative projects using personal devices emphasized. Final assessment is conducted through summative evaluation

learning_goals: Learners can analyze prerequisite knowledge among learning contents and represent it as a graph structure.
Model 10 or more language learning elements as node-link relationships using Gephi/Pajek tools.
Generate and comparatively evaluate three optimal learning sequence versions through project deliverables.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
